s1: Massive amounts of data are being collected by public and private organisations, and research projects, while the Internet provides a very large source of information about almost every aspect of human life and society.
s2: Demonstrate a thorough understanding of the fundamental principles underlying the identification and testing for vulnerabilities with limited information.

s1: This course provides a practical focus on the technology and research in the area of data mining.
s2: This is a complete course in cyber attacks which enables students on successful completion to identify and test systems for vulnerabilities without full knowledge or direct access.

s1: It focuses on the algorithms and techniques and less on the mathematical and statistical foundations.
s2: Offensive Cyber Security operations introduces and exercises a complete range of reverse engineering techniques and attack patterns. Students will also learn and exercise analysis of systems based on minimal information.

s1: Critically analyse and justify the steps involved in the data mining process.
s2: Offensive Cyber Security operations introduces and exercises a complete range of reverse engineering techniques and attack patterns. Students will also learn and exercise analysis of systems based on minimal information.

s1: Anticipate and identify data issues related to data mining.
s2: Communicate a cyber security vulnerability and potential paths of attack to a heterogenous team of professionals.

s1: Justify suitable techniques to use for a given data mining problem.
s2: Expand conventional attack patterns to work in new system and network architectures.
